intro: Epilobium lanceolatum var. maderense, commonly known as Mader's willowherb, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils along stream banks and in woodlands. It is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with distinctive capsules as fruit. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
